message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving the performance of Neural Machine Translation (NMT) using back-translation and sampling strategies. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to natural language processing and machine learning. The paper also discusses the use of prediction losses and frequencies of words, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes variations of sampling strategies, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of NMT models also suggests that it could belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper mentions the WMT news translation task, which could indicate that it belongs to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) since this task involves image captioning and video description.
